availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Burnett, Jr. (Trigg County, Kentucky, census enumerator)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, student. Kentucky native. Son of Isaac Burnett and Martha F. Garnett Burnett. Attended school in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Enumerator of the United States census for Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 292B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 194.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 393A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 53A.
"The Census- Assistant Marshals for Kentucky," -Daily Courier_, (Louisville, KY), 5 Jun 1860, p. 1.
"Isaac G. Burnett (1838-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 88316488 , accessed June 21, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88316488 .
